title: HR Manager Job at HR-Aid Consults
content:
HR-Aid Consults - Our client in the beauty & fashion industry is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In this role, under the supervision of the Chief Operating Officer, you will be responsible for leading the HR functions of the company and juggle various administrative tasks in a timely manner.
	As the HR/Admin Manager, you will provide oversight and guidance to the development and monitoring of processes related to HR Operations, recruitment and retention, compliance, compensation, benefits, training, and development, as well as oversee administrative processes


Key Responsibilities


	Create and implement effective onboarding plans
	Coordinate with training centres for employee development and follow up until receiving training certificates
	Review the employment and working conditions to ensure legal compliance
	Track staffing requirements and oversee the hiring of new employees as needed
	Coordinate general leave administration; this includes maintaining an annual leave calendar for leave projections, outstanding leave days, payment of leave allowances
	Maintain and update all staff personnel files using appropriate checklist to ensure complete documentation
	Take the lead on performance management process with collation of mid-year and end of year review documentations as well as draft confirmation letters for staff who are due
	Ensure the smooth and adequate flow of information within the company to facilitate other business operations
	Monitor inventory of office supplies and the purchasing of new material with attention to budgetary constraints
	Provide advice to management on employee relations issues including maintaining payment schedules and issuing memos to accounts for payment/due dates for Pension, Health Insurance and other statutory deductions
	Planning and coordinating administrative procedures and systems and devising ways to streamline processes
	Monitor costs and expenses to assist in budget preparation
	Ensure regular update of the HR database with information on personnel records, bio data, salaries, or promotion as well as negotiations.


Key Qualifications and Experience


	BSc in a Human Resources Management/Industrial Relations & Personnel Management Master’s degree in Business Administration is an added advantage
	CIPM certification is a key requirement
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, 2 of which should be an administrative role. Experience in the fashion industry is compulsory


Skills:


	Excellent leadership skills
	Strong written and oral communication
	Organization and attention to detail
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Time management
	Ability to navigate stressful situations Must demonstrate a high level of confidentiality, tact, discretion, initiative, and sound judgement
	Ability to cope with pressures and setbacks
	Ability to deliver results and meet customer expectations.
	Must demonstrate the confidence and ability to relate with stakeholders (clients, vendors, suppliers etc.) in an assertive and professional way
	Must have the ability to manage the flow of people and business, liaise and consult with internal and external stakeholders for maximum efficiency.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ada@hr-aidconsults.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Front Desk Officer Job at Nigeria Society of Engineers (NSE)
content:
The Nigeria Society of Engineers (NSE) is the umbrella organisation for the engineering profession in Nigeria. It looks after the professional needs of all Engineers in their vide spectrum of specializations through structured initiatives in membership and other high professional standard and ethical practices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Welcoming and offering assistance to guests and clients
	Handling incoming calls and providing information on enquiries Managing appointment calendars, booking meetings and coordinating schedules as may be required
	Receiving, sorting, and distributing mails and deliveries Keeping and organised and welcoming front office at all times Maintaining and updating a central telephone directory and other essential documentation
	Monitoring visitor access and ensuring compliance with security protocols.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	Higher National Diploma or a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Office and Information Management, Mass Communication or any other related course.
	Additional certification in customer care will be an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of three (3) years of work experience in a customer service role.


Competencies:


	Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with immaculate telephone conversation skills
	Ability to maintain professional demeanour and attitude always
	Good corporate dress sense
	Excellent organisational and time management skills Attention to details and problem-solving skills
	Proficiency in software applications such as Microsoft Office Ability to adapt to changing situations, priorities and deadlines.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: es@nse.org.ng and copy: bilenikhena@nse.org.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
Or
Send a written application, curriculum vitae and copies of cerificates to:
The Executive Secretary,
The Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE),
National Engineering Centre,
Plot 1035, Sani Abacha Way, Adjacent National Mosque,
Central Business District, Abuja.

title: Procurement Supervisor Job at Kinetic Electromechanic Nigeria Limited
content:
Kinetic Electromechanic Nigeria Limited - We are a renowned Building, Industrial, Engineering and Facility Management Company in Port Harcourt, Rivers State Nigeria. We offer Engineering solutions in Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation and Plumbing to our esteemed client.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Supervisor

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Procurement & Supply Chain
Reports To: Operations Manager

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Procurement Supervisor will manage and coordinate all procurement activities for Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing (MEP), Construction, and Fabrication projects.
	This role ensures timely and cost-effective acquisition of materials, equipment, and services while maintaining quality and compliance with technical specifications and project timelines.


Key Responsibilities
Procurement Operations:


	Supervise the procurement of MEP systems and components (HVAC, plumbing, fire protection, electrical), structural materials, fabrication tools, and general construction items.
	Ensure timely issuance of purchase orders (POs) and delivery of materials to meet project schedules.
	Review material requisitions (MRs), vendor quotations, and ensure compliance with specifications and quality standards.
	Coordinate with Engineers and Project Managers to understand technical specifications and material requirements.
	Monitor market trends and conduct cost analysis to ensure competitive pricing.


Vendor and Contract Management:


	Source, evaluate, and develop reliable vendors and subcontractors.
	Negotiate contracts, prices, delivery schedules, and payment terms to achieve best value.
	Establish and monitor vendor KPIs, including quality, delivery, and responsiveness.
	Maintain a qualified and approved vendor list for MEP, Construction, and Fabrication categories.


Compliance and Reporting:


	Ensure procurement activities comply with internal controls, budgetary limits, and company policies.
	Maintain accurate procurement records including contracts, POs, material delivery status, and reports.
	Generate weekly and monthly reports on procurement activities, vendor performance, and project material status.


Team Collaboration & Support:


	Liaise with Warehouse, Logistics, QA/QC, and Finance departments for seamless material flow.
	Assist in resolving supplier issues, delays, or non-conformance reports (NCRs).
	Guide and support procurement officers in daily activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Member CIPS.
	5 –7 years of procurement experience, with at least 3 years in a supervisory role within MEP, Construction, or Fabrication industry.


Technical Skills:


	Good knowledge of MEP systems, fabrication materials (pipes, fittings, plates, welding materials), and construction goods.
	Proficient in ERP software (Navision, SAP, Oracle, Sage, etc.) and Microsoft Office tools.
	Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Sound understanding of procurement policies, inventory control, and contract law.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: vacanciesmyway@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Business Development Manager Job at Aiderr Project Services
content:
Aiderr Project Services is a global provider of industrial goods and equipment, serving the energy and industrial markets. As one of the world’s leading supply chain solutions companies, we help businesses boost their productivity through integrated supply chain management. Operating from our U.S. headquarters in Texas, we provide high-quality sourcing for clients around the world. Our customers look to us for the operations and maintenance (O&M) products that help their businesses run smoothly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for lead generation and conversion.
	Nurturing client relationships, and ensuring revenue growth.
	Planning, monitoring and report status of BD initiatives.
	Increasing brand awareness & ensuring customer satisfaction.


Duites
Outreaches- 40%


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities in target sectors (oil & gas, EPCs, IOCs etc.) that fit into company’s competencies.
	Present company capabilities to potential customers and partners.
	Track and report monthly progress on sales targets, pipelines, and conversion ratios.
	Develop and Implement Business Development/Marketing Plan.
	Create detailed plans for reaching BD goals and objectives.
	Prospect and negotiate partner agreements.
	Lead the registration and prequalification of the company with major industry platforms (e.g. NIPEX, NCDMB, IOC vendor portals).


Bid Administration 40%


	Identify bid opportunities through various channels and track tender portals for opportunities that align with Aiderr business.
	Coordinate bid/no bid meeting & manage bid log.
	Coordinate, collate and prepare responses to EOIs and tenders.
	Clarify bid queries with vendors.


Market Intelligence 20%


	Identify and map customer needs.
	Research new opportunities / service and viable streams of income.
	Conduct market research to establish trends, competitor and customer analysis to determine strategy for market penetration.


KRAs/KPIs (subject to periodic review)


	% of new client acquisition per month.
	Bid win/lose ration 35%+ success rate.
	Client retention - 90% active contract renewal.
	Revenue growth - 10-15% quarterly increase.
	Market penetration - entry into at least 1 new segment/year.


Requirements
Qualification


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Marketing, or related field.
	5 - 7 years of progressive Business Development experience.
	An MBA or Postgraduate Degree is an added advantage.
	Relevant Oil & Gas Industry experience.
	Proven track record in winning contracts, closing deals, and client account growth.
	Familiarity with tendering processes of IOCs, EPCs.


Certifications (Preferred but not mandatory)


	Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) or Project Management (PMP, PRINCE2).
	Sales or BD Certifications (e.g. HubSpot etc).
	NIPEX/NCDMB Vendor Engagement Training.


Attributes


	Driven
	Analytical
	Hungry-Humble-Smart
	Excellent negotiation skill


Skills


	Good presentation and pitch delivery skills
	Strong networking and interpersonal influence
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
	Organizational & analytical skill
	Ability to lead self, multi- task and manage time effectively


Key Competencies


	Business Acumen – Understand market trends, financial implications, and commercial strategies.
	Influencer – relationship building, managing, as well as negotiation.
	Results seeker – driven by goals and deadlines.
	Innovator – thinks ahead, anticipates change, and respond to it.
	Adaptor – handles pressure and criticism well, stays calm and collected.
	Compiler – follows protocol and encourages others to follow suit


Desirable Competencies


	Thorough knowledge of regulations governing the industry


Conditions of Employment


	Subject to Aiderr Project Services condition of Employment.
	Approximately 40 hours per week (minimum 8 hours per day Mon-Fri).
	4 weeks’ notice must be provided for the termination of the contract.
	Employee shall regard all information/data provided by Aiderr and its client as confidential and shall not disclose such details and information to a third party without the written approval of Aiderr.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and Applications to: HEA.careers@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
